text:
Emir Uyar (born 1983) is the Vice Chairman of Permak Group, a major Turkish company, and is also the Honorary General Consul of Dominica to Turkey. He is the son of businessman Selim Uyar, who is the founder of Permak Group.
Emir Uyar owns many old buildings and places in Europe, like the famous San Clemente Kempinski Palace Hotel in Venice, Italy. The hotel's brand name is now under Kempinski Hotels. He bought the whole island of San Clemente in Italy, which was one of the largest investments between Italy and Turkey. Uyar also helps build solar power in Turkey.
Education.
Uyar graduated from Deutsche Schule Istanbul and got a Bachelor's degree in Business and Economics from the University of Southern California (USC) in the United States.
Career.
Emir Uyar is the Vice Chairman of Turkey's Permak Group and Chairman of the Permak Investments. Permak Group does business in real estate, machinery, energy, technology, and retail.
He manages the Permak Group's investments, and also owns the Kempinski Palace Hotel on San Clemente Island in Venice, Italy. Uyar was the Honorary General Consul of Dominica to Istanbul since 2014.
Uyar helped build solar power in Turkey in places like Çankırı. He has also invested very much in luxury properties in Lake Como, which is also home to George Clooney's summer house.
